title: Lalu Yadav removes son Tej Pratap from party and family after 'relationship confession' post
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav expelled his eldest son, Tej Pratap Yadav, from the RJD for six years, citing disregard for moral values after a controversial Facebook post. Tej Pratap claimed his account was hacked following a post about a 12-year relationship, which he later retracted. This decision follows Tej Pratap's previous marriage troubles and allegations of mistreatment.

title: ‘Intolerable’: Tejashwi backs Lalu’s move to disown brother Tej Pratap
content: Tejashwi Yadav addressed his brother Tej Pratap's Facebook post confessing a 12-year relationship amidst divorce proceedings, stating the party disapproves but respects his autonomy. Lalu Prasad Yadav subsequently expelled Tej Pratap from the RJD for six years, citing disregard for moral values and family principles. The expulsion follows Tej Pratap's troubled marriage to Aishwarya Rai and ongoing divorce battle.

title: Gone in 2023, back in 2025: How stolen phones are coming back to owners
content: Across India, stolen phones are being returned to police thanks to the CEIR portal, which tracks handsets via IMEI numbers. Ghaziabad police have recovered nearly 1,200 phones, with individuals from various states returning them after being notified. While the recovery rate lags behind the number of phones located, states are improving their processes to reunite owners with their devices.

title: 'I'm not playing ... ': MS Dhoni's heartfelt message for fans
content: MS Dhoni's immense popularity with fans is evident in the electrifying atmosphere he creates whenever he plays. Dhoni acknowledges the fans' appreciation as a heartfelt thank you for his contributions over the years. Despite CSK's elimination from playoff contention, Dhoni's presence remains a significant highlight for fans, sparking speculation about his IPL future and solidifying his legendary status.

title: 5 yrs of Black Lives Matter: 3 ways MAGA changed narrative around Floyd's death
content: As the fifth anniversary of Floyd’s death approaches, here are three ways the MAGA movement has flipped the narrative — turning a symbol of police brutality into an emblem of right-wing grievance.

title: Google founder Sergey Brin on going back to work after retirement: There's just never been a ...
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: Deadly windstorms sweep Pakistan, leaving 14 dead and over 100 injured
content: Powerful windstorms, following a severe heatwave with temperatures exceeding 45°C, have devastated central and northern Pakistan, resulting in at least 14 deaths and over 100 injuries. The destructive storms, characterized by high winds and reduced visibility due to dust, caused widespread damage to infrastructure, uprooted trees, and collapsed buildings. Pakistan's Meteorological Department forecasts more storms, raising concerns about further casualties.

title: Shubman Gill compares Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's captaincy styles
content: Shubman Gill has been named India's Test captain, succeeding Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, with Rishabh Pant as his deputy for the upcoming England series. Gill, at 25, acknowledges the influence of his predecessors, noting Kohli's aggressive leadership and Sharma's calm, tactical approach. Having debuted in 2020, Gill has played 32 Test matches, amassing 1,893 runs with five centuries.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink India launch: Price, benefits of satellite internet and more
content: Starlink and other satellite internet services are planning to launch in India. Promotional unlimited data plans might be available for under Rs 840 per month. Hardware costs could be high. Despite regulatory approvals for some, technical constraints may limit subscriber numbers. Satellite internet aims to reach underserved regions. The competition is heating up in India's telecom market.

title: 'Upgrade nukes ... ': What US report reveals about Pak's military ambitions
content: A US intelligence report reveals Pakistan's military priorities, emphasizing nuclear modernization and addressing cross-border tensions with regional neighbors. China remains Pakistan's primary defense partner, providing economic and military support, while terrorist attacks targeting Chinese workers pose a challenge. Pakistan views India as a strategic threat, driving its military modernization efforts, including battlefield nuclear weapons.

title: Graves desecrated in MP's Khandwa, police suspect occult link
content: In Khandwa district, Madhya Pradesh, the desecration of six graves, including those of five women, has sparked outrage and prompted a police investigation. Relatives discovered the graves disturbed, with signs of tampering near the feet, leading to suspicions of occult practices.

title: ‘They lost Annabelle?’ Internet meltdown over haunted doll - what happened
content: The infamous Annabelle doll recently sparked internet frenzy after rumors spread about its disappearance during a paranormal tour in the US. This occurred shortly after a fire at a Louisiana resort where it was displayed. Despite the panic, the New England Society for Psychic Research confirmed the doll's safety.

title: LinkedIn co-founder: Startup founders talking about work-life balance are not …
content: Reid Hoffman, LinkedIn's co-founder, has sparked controversy by asserting that startup founders prioritizing work-life balance lack the dedication needed for success. He defended his stance, stating that achieving significant startup growth demands intense focus and a temporary sacrifice of personal time.

title: Trans woman becomes Navi Mumbai’s first auto-rickshaw driver after years of struggle
content: Kareena Aade, a 49-year-old transgender woman, is breaking barriers as the first trans-person auto driver in the Mumbai metropolitan region. Shunned by her family years ago, she arrived in Mumbai with nothing and worked various jobs before an NGO gifted her an e-auto.

title: MS Dhoni breaks silence on fitness: 'It's surviving,' he tells Ravi Shastri
content: Mahendra Singh Dhoni's Chennai Super Kings elected to bat first after winning the toss against Gujarat Titans in their IPL match. Gujarat, aiming for a top-two finish, made one change, bringing in Gerald Coetzee for Kagiso Rabada. CSK, already out of contention, replaced Ashwin with Hooda, seeking to experiment with their lineup and provide opportunities to young players.

title: Brains to skin: Ex-Harvard employee stole body parts and sold them in black market
content: Cedric Lodge, a former Harvard employee, admitted to trafficking stolen human remains from the university's morgue between 2018 and 2020. He illicitly removed body parts, including organs and brains, and transported them to his home in New Hampshire.

title: ‘Kill and dump’: Baloch journalist gunned down in front of family in Pakistan
content: Abdul Latif Baloch, a journalist, was killed in Balochistan. He was known for reporting on human rights issues. The Baloch Yakjehti Committee blames state-backed groups. His son and other relatives were earlier found dead. Activists cite a 'kill and dump' policy. Shalee Baloch calls it 'systemic violence'. Human rights groups are urging international action.

title: 'Opens new wounds': Man whose parents' memorial was called 'burial site' by Trump
content: Nathan Rafferty, an Australian resident, expressed shock after a video featuring his parents' memorial was shown during a meeting between Donald Trump and Cyril Ramaphosa. Trump used the clip to support claims of a "genocide" against white South Africans, a charge Rafferty disputes.

title: Why Japan's Gen Z is 'quiet quitting' work
content: In Japan, a growing number of workers, particularly those in their 20s, are embracing "quiet quitting," prioritizing personal time and work-life balance over traditional corporate loyalty. This shift is driven by a desire for more "me time," dissatisfaction with compensation, and a rejection of the sacrifices made by previous generations.

title: Russia unleashes largest air onslaught on Ukraine killing at least 12
content: Russia launched its most extensive aerial assault on Ukraine since the war's onset, targeting over 30 cities and villages with missiles and drones, resulting in casualties and widespread damage. The attacks coincided with Kyiv Day, intensifying the tragedy. Despite the ongoing conflict, Russia and Ukraine conducted a significant prisoner exchange, offering a glimmer of hope amid stalled ceasefire efforts.

title: 'Want those names and countries': Trump on blocking foreign students at Harvard
content: Donald Trump defended his administration's attempt to block foreign students at Harvard, alleging that nearly a third of their students are international and contribute nothing financially, while their countries may not be friendly to the US. He criticized Harvard's lack of transparency regarding these students, especially given the federal funding the university receives.

title: The tilting ship: A toxic turn in Kerala waters
content: A Liberia-flagged container vessel, MSC ELSA 3, tilted dangerously off the Kochi coast, prompting a rescue operation. Twenty-one of the twenty-four crew members were rescued, while the captain and two engineers stayed to assist salvage efforts. Some containers with hazardous cargo, including marine gas oil, fell into the sea.

title: Shubman Gill's first words as Team India's Test captain
content: Shubman Gill expressed immense honor and responsibility upon being named India's Test captain, succeeding Rohit Sharma. Selectors appointed Gill to lead the team for the upcoming five-Test series in England, with Rishabh Pant as vice-captain. Ajit Agarkar cited Gill's progress and potential as key factors in the decision. Gill, who has featured as both an opener and No. 3 in India’s Test line-up, steps into the leadership role following Rohit Sharma’s retirement from the format earlier this month. In 32 Tests, Gill has scored 1893 runs at an average of 35.1, with five centuries and seven fifties to his name.

title: ‘Husband said why don’t you die’: UP woman dies by suicide, alleges harassment by in-laws
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, a 23-year-old newly-wed, Samreen, tragically died by suicide, leaving behind a video accusing her husband and in-laws of severe harassment. She alleged constant mental torture and mistreatment following a miscarriage. Samreen claimed her in-laws criticized her eating habits and disconnected power to her room.

title: Flash floods wreak havoc in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu, over 20 vehicles damaged
content: Heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district triggered flash floods, damaging 20-25 vehicles in Sharshaya Nallah. No casualties were reported, but debris blocked the Hindustan-Tibet Road. The local meteorological department has issued a yellow warning for thunderstorms and gusty winds across all 12 districts, forecasting a six-day wet spell with light rainfall expected in higher hills.

title: British-Indian twins Krish and Keira, 11, join elite Mensa club with combined IQ of 314
content: British-Indian twins, Krish and Keira, have gained membership into Mensa after excelling in IQ tests. Krish scored 162, placing him in the top 0.26%, while Keira achieved 152, putting her in the top 2%. Their mother, Mauli Arora, noted their competitive nature and diverse interests.

title: 5 years since George Floyd murder, Black lives still matter
content: Black Lives Matter Plaza in Washington saw changes. The BLM movement made global waves after George Floyd's murder. Protests occurred worldwide, but initial hopes for change remain unfulfilled in the US. Donald Trump's administration halted DEI programs. Police violence persists, disproportionately affecting Black people. Despite challenges, discussions about racism have evolved. Some states banned the knee-to-neck maneuver.

title: 9 Bengaluru citizens revive dying Sarakki lake
content: Driven by nine determined citizens, Sarakki Lake in Bengaluru underwent a remarkable revival after decades of neglect. The Sarakki Lake Area Improvement Trust (SLAIT) successfully combatted sewage inflow, encroachments, and ecological damage through strategic partnerships and legal action.

title: Indian national anthem at Monte Carlo as Kush Maini wins F2 race – Watch
content: Kush Maini made history as the first Indian to win a Formula 2 race in Monaco. Driving for DAMS Lucas Oil, he secured a dominant victory in the Sprint Race, starting from pole and maintaining his lead throughout. An emotional Maini celebrated on the podium, with the Indian national anthem playing.

title: ‘If only they fought like Rani of Jhansi’: BJP MP blames women for Pahalgam death toll
content: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Ram Chander Jangra sparked controversy by suggesting women killed in the Pahalgam terror attack lacked bravery. He claimed that if they had training or fought back, casualties would have been lower. Jangra referenced PM Modi's Agniveer initiative and historical figures like Rani of Jhansi, drawing criticism.

title: 'Don't work for govt': What Tharoor said on Op Sindoor, India's stand on terrorism
content: Leading an all-party delegation in the US, Shashi Tharoor defended India's strong response to the Pahalgam terror attack, emphasizing the precision strikes of Operation Sindoor. The delegation, including members from various parties and former Ambassador Sandhu, aims to present a united front against terrorism to global audiences.

title: After 40 years in darkness, electricity returns to this Chhattisgarh village
content: After four decades of darkness due to Maoist activity, Polampad village in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district rejoiced as electricity was restored in 2024. The establishment of a CRPF camp nearby ensured safety, enabling the government to restart infrastructure projects, including power restoration. This development promises to open doors to progress and improved living conditions for the villagers.

title: Blamed for motor fire, farm worker crushed to death by landowner in front of son in MP
content: In Harda district, Madhya Pradesh, Anil Jat was arrested. He allegedly killed Vikram Kewat, a farm worker. Jat accused Kewat of damaging an irrigation pump. Jat reportedly ran over Kewat with his car, twice. The incident occurred in Goyat village. Police have registered a case and are investigating. The superintendent of police inspected the site.

title: 'When it comes to India's integrity ... ' : Owaisi dismisses political differences
content: As part of an all-party delegation to Bahrain, AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi strongly denounced Pakistan, labeling it a "failed state" and the source of cross-border terrorism against India. The delegation, led by BJP MP Baijayant Panda, aims to inform international partners about India's ongoing struggle with terrorism emanating from Pakistan.

title: Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli visit Hanuman Garhi temple in Ayodhya
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli have been spotted visiting spiritual sites, starting with Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan, where they engaged in 'Jap Naam.' Following this, the couple visited the Hanuman Garhi temple in Ayodhya, receiving blessings and adoration.

title: Delhi storm disrupts air travel: 49 flights diverted, several delayed
content: Delhi experienced a severe thunderstorm overnight, with heavy rain and strong winds reaching 82 kmph. The intense weather caused significant disruptions, including the diversion of 49 flights at Indira Gandhi International Airport and widespread waterlogging on key roads like Moti Bagh and Minto Road. Flight operations have resumed, but delays persist, and traffic congestion remains a challenge in several areas.

title: From Maoist shadows to milestones: PM Modi hails transformation in Katejhari, Dantewada
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted the positive changes in Katejhari, Maharashtra, and Dantewada, Chhattisgarh. Katejhari celebrated the arrival of its first bus service after years of Maoist violence. Dantewada achieved outstanding results in the recent 10th and 12th board examinations. The district topped the state in Class 10 and secured sixth position in Class 12. These developments showcase the resilience and progress in regions previously affected by Maoism.

title: 110% more than average rainfall took sting out of summer in Chennai
content: Chennai experienced significantly higher rainfall this summer, exceeding the average by 110%. The southwest monsoon arrived early in Kerala, prompting a red alert for Coimbatore and The Nilgiris due to anticipated heavy rainfall. Fishermen are cautioned against venturing into the sea, while Chennai expects overcast skies and thunderstorms. A new depression is expected to form over the Bay of Bengal.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli & Anushka Sharma visit Ayodhya's Hanuman Garhi temple
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's spiritual journey continues with a visit to Ayodhya's Shree Hanuman Garhi temple, following their retreat to Vrindavan. Donning traditional white saropas, the couple's serene presence and devotion resonated with fans. This visit, amidst Kohli's IPL commitments, highlights their deepening connection to India's spiritual heritage and moments of reflection.

title: '2015 was Pak's last chance': Tharoor recalls Pathankot betrayal after PM's Lahore visit
content: Shashi Tharoor, leading an all-party delegation in the US, highlighted India's past peace efforts towards Pakistan, which were followed by terror attacks like Pathankot in 2016. Tharoor emphasized that after years of failed attempts at diplomacy, India has adopted a new approach with Operation Sindoor, conducting precise strikes against terror infrastructure.

title: UP sub-inspector dies while sleeping as ACP office roof collapses during heavy rains
content: In Ghaziabad, a 58-year-old sub-inspector, Veerendra Mishra, tragically died when the roof of the Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACP) office in Ankur Vihar collapsed during severe storms and heavy rainfall. Mishra, who was working late, was fatally injured when the building, previously a police chowki, gave way around 2 am. Authorities have initiated an investigation into the incident.

title: Too soon or perfect timing? Experts weigh in on Shubman Gill's elevation
content: Shubman Gill's appointment as Test captain, though surprising to some, was a carefully considered decision by Indian selectors, dating back to the T20 World Cup. His captaincy in the Zimbabwe T20Is and leadership in the Gujarat Titans solidified his potential.

title: Chittapur ‘confinement’ row: ‘It was natural public response to unprovoked criminal remarks’, says Sharan Prakash Patil
content: The Minister termed BJP’s ‘Kalaburagi Chalo’ agitation against Priynak Kharge as a “ridiculous uproar” by BJP leaders who had lost their moral compass and ability to differentiate between right and wrong.

title: Officials keen to make rural people participate in Yogandhra-2025
content: The Mandal-level officials have to make people enrol in the yoga portal which would in turn help them to know about the nearby yoga centres and trainers

title: Lalu Prasad expels elder son Tej Pratap Yadav from party and family for ‘irresponsible behaviour’
content: Party sources says the decision has been taken keeping the upcoming Assembly elections which may cost the political future and public image of his younger son Tejashwi Yadav

title: Gujarat bypolls: Visavadar seat to witness three-way fight
content: The AAP has already announced the candidature of Gopal Italia from the Visavadar seat, and the Congress had earlier stated that it would not be entering into an alliance and would go it alone in the bypolls.

title: Kerala Govt to form rapid response teams to handle containers, oil spills from Liberia container ship that sunk off Kochi coast
content: It is estimated that the containers have a higher probability of washing ashore in Alappuzha, Kollam, Ernakulam and Thiruvananthapuram districts

title: Playing cards for entertainment and recreation without gambling is not moral turpitude: Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court restores election in cooperative society, ruling playing cards without gambling isn’t moral turpitude

title: AIADMK to protest against Kodungaiyur dump yard waste-to-energy plant project on June 2
content: The party’s women’s wing secretary B. Valarmathi would lead the protest near the post office opposite to Greater Chennai Corporation Zone 4 office from 10 a.m.

title: Man arrested for setting Yadgir district Congress office on fire
content: The accused is said to have been upset after his wife was replaced by another woman for the president’s post of the Mahila Morcha.

title: Strictly comply with court orders, prevent contempt petitions: T.N. government instructs its departments
content: The communication issued a few weeks ago to all the departments, followed a request from an Additional Advocate-General, who flagged “serious concern repeatedly expressed” by the judges of the Madras High Court over the increasing number of contempt petitions arising from persistent non-compliance with judicial orders.

title: Construction of stage for protesting teachers at new site begins following Calcutta HC directive
content: On Friday, the Calcutta High Court directed the agitating teachers to move their indefinite sit-in demonstration to Central Park, around 200 metres from their earlier location

title: Dust storm affects normal life in parts of Rajasthan; two killed as wall collapses
content: Electricity supply was disrupted in parts of Bikaner, Sikar and Jhunjhunu as the storm uprooted electric poles and trees late on Saturday night

title: Meghalaya’s new cave-dwelling fish adapts to streams overground
content: The loach, Schistura densiclava, was recorded from the Mawjymbuin cave in the East Khasi Hills district

title: Repair work completed in 243 Dakshina Kannada schools that suffered damage in last year’s rain
content: A proposal has been sent to the government this year seeking ₹15.17 crore for repair work in 334 schools, which includes 39 schools that suffered damage so far due to rains in May.

title: Asaduddin Owaisi calls Pakistan a ‘failed state’ during interaction in Bahrain, says India exercised maximum restraint
content: Asaduddin Owaisi stressed the need for international cooperation in curbing terror financing and urged the Bahrain government to support efforts to bring Pakistan back to the FATF grey list

title: Nagaland group announces stir against job quota for backward tribes
content: The 30-day deadline for reforms, set by the Five Tribes Committee on Review of Reservation Policy, expires on Sunday

title: Overnight heavy rains threw life out of gear in Kerala; IMD issues red alerts for five districts
content: The National Centre for Ocean Information Services (INCOIS) has warned of high waves, tidal surges, and sea erosion.

title: Bengaluru man assaulted by Zepto delivery agent over wrong address
content: Police have booked Vishnvardhan under BNS sections 115(2), 126(2), and 351, and summoned him for questioning.

title: Nilambur by-elections: A significant ballot box test for LDF and UDF  on June 19
content: The opposition leader says the UDF will announce its candidate for Nilambur within 24 hours. He said the UDF would put the LDF’s “misrule” on public trial in Nilambur

title: MoD confirms sinking of Liberian ship off Kochi coast with 640 containers, including 13 with hazardous cargo
content: The vessel went down with 640 containers, including 13 with hazardous cargo and 12 containing calcium carbide

title: CM Stalin failed to address Tamil Nadu’s needs by boycotting past NITI Aayog meetings: Palaniswami
content: Mr. Palaniswami contended the Chief Minister could have got the funds and schemes due for the State if he had participated in the NITI Aayog meetings in the last three years.

title: ONGC makes promising oil, gas discoveries in Mumbai offshore
content: The discoveries, which have been named Suryamani and Vajramani, were made in OALP-VI block MB-OSHP-2020/2 and OALP-III block MB-OSHP- 2018/1, both in the offshore Mumbai basin.

title: Nine families in Kerala’s Vilangad moved to safer location
content: The group including 13 men, 12 women and 11 children have been moved to the rehabilitation camp set up at St. George High School, Vilangad.

title: Siraj-Ur-Rehaman, Syed Sameer being grilled at Police Training College in Vizianagaram
content: The accused are being grilled every day, ever since they were given one week police custody, a couple of days ago

title: Apologise and sack Jangra, Congress tells PM Modi after BJP MP’s insensitive remarks on Pahalgam victims
content: “Why should the silence of Prime Minister Modi and the BJP leadership not be considered a tacit approval of these statements?” Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said

title: Caste census not divisive, it will strengthen social justice: Scheduled Caste rights panel chief
content: NCSC Chairperson Kishor Makwana supports caste enumeration in census for social justice and policy decisions, rejecting division concerns

title: New law on the cards to ban basement parking in low-lying areas in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru Development Minister D.K. Shivakumar said a compensation of ₹10,000 will be given to each household affected by flooding caused due to torrential rains in several parts of the city.

title: NDA meeting adopts resolution praising armed forces, PM Modi
content: Praising Modi’s leadership, it said he has always supported the armed forces and that Operation Sindoor has given a befitting reply to terrorists and their sponsors

title: Consumer panel orders power company to pay ₹10 lakh to Nagpur farmer for crop damage
content: The farmer alleged that on March 22, 2018, the trees caught fire due to friction and sparking between two wires of high-tension transmission line passing over his field and were completely burnt.

title: Pahalgam attack: BJP MP sparks row saying tourists should have fought terrorists and women lacked ‘warrior spirit’; apologises saying his statement was distorted
content: The number of casualties would have been less had the tourists undergone the Agniveer training, BJP Rajya Sabha MP Ram Chander Jangra said

title: Mann ki Baat: Operation Sindoor not just military mission, but reflection of changing India, says PM Modi
content: PM Modi emphasised that the operation was not a one-off military action, but a reflection of a changing and resolute India

title: Byelection to Nilambur assembly constituency in Kerala on June 19
content: With the announcement of the poll date, the Model Code of Conduct has come into force in Malappuram district, as per the existing ECI guidelines

title: Kerala bypoll: Nilambur bypoll on June 23; UDF, LDF set to declare candidates
content: Nilambur Assembly constituency comprises Nilambur municipality and the panchayats of Vazhikkadavu, Moothedam, Edakkara, Pothukal, Chungathara, Karulai and Amarambalam.

title: Southwest monsoon likely to reach A.P. in next three days
content: The State has received 88.5 mm of rain against the normal of 39.2 mm between May 1 and May 21, a departure by 126% from the normal, according to IMD

title: News in Frames: Chasing the monsoon
content: The southwest monsoon brings with it bountiful rain as well as a much-needed relief from the heat of the summer; this year, it has arrived eight days earlier than usual, marking the earliest onset since 2009

title: Shashi Tharoor slams Kerala Govt for aid to Turkiye in 2023; John Brittas reminds him aid was part of Union Govt’s ‘Operation Dost’
content: John Brittas said Mr.Tharoor’s comment on Kerala’s aid to Turkiye after 2023 earthquake, “are symptoms of selective amnesia.”

title: Operation Sindoor face of changing India: PM Modi in Mann Ki Baat - Key highlights
content: Prime Minister Modi, in Mann Ki Baat, lauded Operation Sindoor's success and the surge in patriotism, highlighting its impact beyond military action. He also celebrated the growth of Asiatic lions in Gir, development in Maoist-affected areas, and women's empowerment through technology. The address further showcased the North East's talent, Gujarat's women forest officers, and inspiring individuals like Jeevan Joshi.

title: Assembly bypolls to five seats in four states on June 19: Election Commission
content: While two assembly bypolls will be held in Gujarat, one each will take place in Kerala, West Bengal and Punjab. The counting of votes will take place on June 23, the poll authority said.

title: Tilted cargo ship off Kochi coast further submerges; all 24 crew members rescued
content: Both Indian ⁠Coast Guard and Indian Navy ships are maintaining their position in the area, monitoring the situation

title: No one sitting in Pakistan will be allowed to believe they can just kill Indian citizens with impunity: Shashi Tharoor
content: “We have no desire to have anything that the Pakistanis have. Sadly, we may be a status quo power. They are not. They are a revisionist power. They covet territory that India controls, and they want to have it at any price,” Mr Tharoor said

title: Monsoon reaches Maharashtra; conditions favourable for further advance, says IMD
content: In Maharashtra, the coastal Konkan and Mumbai have been witnessing heavy pre-monsoon rains over the last two days.

title: Four people, including wildlife activist Radheshyam Pemani, killed in road accident in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer
content: The deceased have been identified as wildlife activist Radheshyam Pemani, Shyam Vishnoi, Kanvraj Singh and forest guard Surendra Chaudhary, police said

title: Rains LIVE: Rains possible in Delhi today; heavy rain alert for some districts of Konkan, western Maharashtra
content: Monsoon advanced into some more parts of the Arabian Sea, Karnataka, entire Goa, parts of Maharashtra, north Bay of Bengal, and parts of Mizoram, Manipur, Nagaland on Sunday, May 25, IMD said.

title: First cherry cargo train set to roll from J&K to Mumbai next month
content: The effort is a welcome initiative if goes off successfully as it will offload the road traffic burden and will enable perishable goods like cherries reach its intended markets with minimal damage

title: My FB page was hacked: Tej Pratap after viral post claims he was 'in relationship'
content: The post had drawn flak from social media users, many of whom reminded the 37-year-old politician of his marriage that took place with much fanfare in 2018

title: Delhi rains: Thunderstorm, rain give Delhi relief from heat, disrupt flights, cause waterlogging
content: The IMD issued a red alert for Delhi and nearby areas, warning of strong thunderstorms, rain, and high-speed winds over the next two to three hours

title: Where does the RBI’s surplus come from? | Explained
content: How much will the Reserve Bank of India transfer to the Central government for 2024-25? What are the reasons for a record transfer of surplus funds? Why isn’t it a dividend? How does the central bank make money? What is the Contingent Risk Buffer?

title: Plans on the anvil to achieve $2.40 trillion GSDP by 2047: Naidu
content: Highlighting the NDA government’s development agenda at the NITI Aayog meeting, he says the Swarnandhra objectives are in alignment with Viksit Bharat vision

title: How will land ports closure impact the region? | Explained
content: How will it affect Bangladesh’s readymade garments sector? What about other sectors like agriculture? What are the exceptions to the May 17 order? Why has the northeast been dragged into the tussle between India and Bangladesh? Will it affect other countries in the region?

title: Banu Mushtaq | Lady with the lamp
content: The Heart Lamp author and International Booker Prize Winner documents stories from unheard corners, jotting down every aspect of the women’s lives, their drudgery, anxieties, as also their joy

title: Why is a growing lion population a worry as well? | Explained
content:
How is a ‘lion census’ conducted in India? Where are they found apart
from the Gir forest in Gujarat?

title: Railway Ministry approves new train between Agartala and Guwahati, trial run of electric locomotives completes
content: The new train will start from Agartala and stop at Narangi (NNGE) station on the outskirts of Guwahati. However, the schedule for this train has not yet been released

title: Chief Kazi to T.N. govt. Salahuddin Mohammed Ayub passes away at 84
content: In a condolence message, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin said he was deeply saddened to hear about the passing of Salahuddin Mohammed Ayub.

title: Bus incident: Manipur group announces civil disobedience
content: The Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity declared the ‘public boycott’ of Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla after the expiry of its 48-hour general strike

title: Afghans can apply for Indian visas again, including investors, artists, sportspersons
content: New online visa module for Afghans rolled out in last week of April, source says; resumption of visa services comes five years after Taliban takeover in Kabul; applicants need Afghan passport, national ID card

title: Inside Tamil Nadu’s textile factories where women reel under harsh summer heat
content: Women garment workers in Tamil Nadu are facing the brunt of a harsh summer. It is clear that, going forward, there is a role for both the government and the factory managements to protect workers from heat stress on shop floors

title: COVID cases rise to four in Andhra Pradesh as two test positive in NTR district
content: Health Department instructs secondary and tertiary hospitals in State to keep isolation wards, oxygen cylinders, ventilators, PPE kits, etc. ready

title: Piyush Goyal meets EU counterpart for second time in a month on FTA talks
content: Mr. Goyal travelled to Brussels on May 23 from Washington, while India's chief negotiator L Satya Srinivas and his team are already at the EU headquarters for the FTA negotiations.

title: Artillery’s firepower reverberates during Operation Sindoor
content: Modernised with Excalibur rounds and tactical UAVs, the regiment provided crucial firepower against terror camps and in retaliating against Pakistani shelling, officials revealed

title: No one should be able to conquer us, even if multiple powers come together: RSS chief Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasises unity, inclusivity, and strength for India’s national security and cultural diversity

title: Tobacco farmer ‘ends’ life in Bapatla district
content: Recurrent losses in farming for the past three years are suspected to have driven the farmer to take the extreme step

title: State Highways begins counting of vehicles on key roads in Vellore
content: The annual exercise that was put on hold during the COVID-19 pandemic has been resumed due to the rise in the number of vehicles. It involves counting vehicles on key stretches, intersections, and border areas to introduce road safety measures

title: Nominations window open for businessline Changemaker Awards 2025
content: Nominations can be made across five categories of awards — Changemaker: Social Transformation; Changemaker: Digital Transformation; Changemaker: Financial Transformation; Young Changemaker and Iconic Changemaker. One flagship award goes to the Changemaker of the Year which is awarded to a person or an organisation that has ushered in far-reaching change.

title: Mamata Banerjee’s absence from NITI Aayog meet draws flak from Opposition
content: BJP and Congress leaders criticise West Bengal CM for skipping key meeting amid stalled central funds; TMC cites prior “insult” as reason

title: Not a favour, but a responsibility: Delhi High Court on child maintenance
content: The court made the observations while hearing a husband’s appeal challenging a local court order requiring him to pay interim maintenance of ₹50,000 per month to his wife for the care of their two children

title: Emergence of new COVID variants detected in India
content: Indian SARS-CoV-2 Genomics Consortium (INSACOG) data shows detection of COVID-19 variants NB.1.8.1 and LF.7 in India, driving rise in cases in Asia

title: Student involved in ‘janivara’ row gets 2.06 lakh rank in KCET
content: Based on the parents’ request and after obtaining a consent letter from them, an expert committee gave the rank considering the average score of the student in PUC and CET.

title: Supreme Court sets aside life imprisonment in murder case on grounds of insanity
content: A Bench of Justice A.S. Oka, who retired on May 24, said the medical check on the man, Dashrath Patra, was conducted five years after the crime and thus “meaningless”

title: Trinamool rallies behind Abhishek Banerjee’s call to restore Rash Behari Bose Memorial in Tokyo
content: Political observers see gesture as part of larger project to honour Bengal’s freedom fighters and assert regional identity

title: Punjab, Himachal seek special financial packages at NITI Aayog meet
content: Chief Ministers flag step-motherly treatment, pending dues, and demand support for border and hill state needs

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Wolves rebound, demolish Thunder in Game 3 rout
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Ant keys Wolves' emphatic response in rout of OKC
content: Behind Anthony Edwards' 30 points in three quarters, the Timberwolves responded to a 2-0 deficit in the Western Conference finals with a decisive 143-101 win over the Thunder in Game 3.

title: OKC 'punched in the mouth' as Wolves muscle up
content: The Thunder credited the Wolves' "physicality" Saturday night in a 143-101 Game 3 loss in which Oklahoma City never mounted a serious comeback bid.

title: Clark, Fever lament officiating late in loss to NY
content: The Liberty remained unbeaten Saturday with a 90-88 win over the Fever, who were not happy with the officiating over the final 10 seconds.

title: Soto answers week of questions with key 2B in win
content: Juan Soto's first extra-base hit since May 9 -- a fourth-inning double at Citi Field -- gave the Mets the lead for good in an eventual 5-2 win over the Dodgers.

title: Sources: Knicks mull benching Hart for Robinson
content: With their starting five struggling, the Knicks are considering moving backup center Mitchell Robinson into the lineup for Josh Hart, sources told ESPN.

title: Judge (18 HRs) insists he's still 'work in progress'
content: Aaron Judge said he still doesn't feel "too great at the plate" yet this season despite hitting nearly .400 with 18 home runs so far this year.

title: Buffalo seals dynasty with historic NLL three-peat
content: The Bandits pulled away for a 15-6 victory in Saturday's decisive Game 3 and became just the second team in NLL history to win three consecutive championships.

title: 🏈 Vols-Bruins 'QB swap' leads portal superlatives
content: We awarded superlatives for a spring college football transfer portal window that saw Tennessee and UCLA swap quarterbacks, among other intriguing moves.

title: Panthers one game away from another Cup Final: Grades, biggest takeaways from Game 3
content: A dominant third period gave Florida a 6-2 and pushed Carolina to the brink. Here's what to watch in Game 4.

title: After 18-year wait, Arsenal are European champs again, ushering in thrilling new UWCL era
content: Arsenal are shock winners of the UEFA Women's Champions League, the first time the trophy went to a club other than Barcelona or Lyon in a decade.

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

title: What does a lap of Monaco in a McLaren feel like? Restrained
content: Lapping the streets of Monaco, one is left with a common feeling within F1: This place is holding cars back.

title: Ancelotti bids emotional farewell to take place among Real Madrid greats
content: Even legends get fired at Real Madrid after a trophyless season, but Ancelotti leaves as the club's most successful coach, and a tough act to follow.

title: Picking the NFL’s most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Commanders hoping Deebo, Tunsil, draft picks will keep Jayden Daniels ascending
content: Washington believes veteran additions Samuel, Tunsil and draft picks at OT, WR will bring different dynamic to offense.

title: Is Betts poised to pass Trout as best player of their generation? Let's find out
content: Mookie Betts is climbing the all-time WAR list the same way Mike Trout once was. We examine the two and dive into which players similarly ruled previous eras.

title: How Xabi Alonso made his rapid rise from rookie coach to Real Madrid
content: Less than three years into his career as a top-level coach, Alonso is returning to Real Madrid, the most pressurized job in football. He's earned it.

title: Sources: De Bruyne heading toward Napoli move
content: Kevin De Bruyne will open talks with Napoli next week over a free agent move to the newly-crowned Serie A champions, rejecting the chance to move to MLS with Chicago Fire FC, sources have told ESPN.

title: Galaxy, San Diego condemn postgame fan brawl
content: The LA Galaxy and San Diego FC condemned the violence that broke out between supporters following the match at Snapdragon Stadium on Saturday afternoon, insisting the incident does not reflect the values of either club.

title: Sunderland's 95th-minute goal seals PL return
content: Sunderland staged a remarkable comeback to beat Sheffield United in the Championship playoff final and return to the Premier League after seven years.

title: Gotham wins inaugural Concacaf W Champions Cup
content: Spain international Esther González scored a late goal as Gotham FC defeated the UANL Tigres 1-0 on Saturday to win the first edition of the CONCACAF W Champions Cup.

title: Miami shows 'soul,' 'fight' in Messi-inspired rally
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano said his players showed soul and fight to come back from a 2-0 halftime deficit to draw 3-3 against the Philadelphia Union on Saturday night at Subaru Park.

title: AC Milan fans bash brass in 'Go Home' protest
content: AC Milan wrapped up their disappointing season with a 2-0 win over Monza on Saturday, but the game was overshadowed by fan protests against the club ownership and hierarchy both before and during the match.

title: Sources: Ansu in talks to leave Barça for Monaco
content: Barcelona forward Ansu Fati is in talks to join French side Monaco next season, various sources have confirmed to ESPN.

title: Congratulations, you've been promoted to the Premier League! Now what?
content: The past six teams to come up to the Premier League have gone straight back down. How can Leeds, Burnley and Sunderland break that cycle next season?

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Amorim. Let's make the arguments for keeping him and making a change.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal shift sights AC Milan's Rafael Leão

content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: "First Whistle, Then Boom": Ex-Hostage's Biggest Fear In Hamas Captivity
content: Thousands of Israelis took to the streets across the country on Saturday night for anti-government rallies, demanding an end to the war and new elections in Israel

title: How Assassination Of This Former PM Derailed Israel-Palestine Peace Process
content: Yitzhak Rabin, former Israel Prime Minister, was assassinated in 1995 by a right-wing extremist who opposed his efforts to make peace with the Palestinians.

title: Panic Grips Patna After Group Fires In Air, 6 Cops Suspended
content: Unidentified individuals in an SUV fired several rounds in the air reportedly over a parking-related dispute in Patna before fleeing, triggering panic.

content: John Woeltz, 37, faces multiple charges including kidnapping, unlawful imprisonment, assault, and criminal possession of a weapon.

title: Liberian Cargo Ship Sinks Near Kerala Coast, All 24 Crew Onboard Rescued
content: The Indian Coast Guard also said it is fully geared to respond to the emerging scenario and is closely monitoring the environmental impact in the aftermath of the sinking of MSC ELSA 3.

title: PM Modi Shows Damaged Terror Camps In 1st Mann Ki Baat Address After Operation Sindoor
content: India launched Operation Sindoor and struck multiple terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir after an attack in Pahalgam left 26 people dead.

title: Australian Officials Airdrop Supplies To Farmers Stranded In Floods

content: At a warehouse managed by online grocer BigBasket in central Mumbai, employees work with military-like precision to pull off deliveries in just 10 minutes.

title: UP Cop Dies After Police Station Roof Collapses On Him Amid Heavy Rain

title: The Prince Of Monaco, His Finances, And The Man Who Held The Keys To It All
content: Claude Palmero was the trusted financial steward of Monaco's royal family for over 20 years, managing everything from investment portfolios to private expenses for Prince Albert II and his sisters.

title: Sources: Ten Hag may replace Alonso at Bayer
content: The Leverkusen crowd salutes Xabi Alonso in his last home match before departing at the end of the season. (1:35) Erik ten Hag is closing in on a return to management with  Bayer Leverkusen , sources have told ESPN. Ten Hag and his representatives have held constructive talks with the  Bundesliga  side and there is hope on both sides that an agreement can be reached. The Dutchman has been without a club since leaving  Manchester United  in November. Sources have told ESPN that he is reluctant to return to former club Ajax, where there is also a vacancy, and that his preference is to take over at Bayer Leverkusen. Leverkusen are looking for a new coach  after Xabi Alonso agreed to a deal  with  Real Madrid  after their manager, Carlo Ancelotti, left to take charge of the  Brazil  national team.
